channel.title: Dreamscape Loading Cursors from Cache

item.title: Dreamscape Loading Cursors from Cache
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:20, topic:428186”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=530880.msg3879918#msg3879918 date=1325967138]

it doesnt matter what the problem was, the point is packing and loading from the cache is going to be a hastle and alot more complicated than this way so youre better off loading them externally.

This. If you look at the image format used in the cache, sprites are not saved in nearly as good quality as if they are loaded externally.

You can load HD sprites though.

did you even read any of this conversation?

no

I just read

sprites are not saved in nearly as good quality

[/quote]

then why bother posting if you cant even read everything?[/quote]

i can, i just didnt

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:12, topic:428186”][quote author=badger41 link=topic=530880.msg3878447#msg3878447 date=1325825096]

packing and using it from inside media.jag isnt nearly as easy as doing it this way(youre better off doing it this way), i had it partially working but the transparency would be turned to black and the quality of the cursor was slightly degraded.

how are you better off, there’s a utility for editing and packing new items into the cache floating around here.

if you would have read my whole post carefully youd see i explain exactly why
[/quote]
isn’t that just a rendering (or packing) issue ;)[/quote]

it doesnt matter what the problem was, the point is packing and loading from the cache is going to be a hastle and alot more complicated than this way so youre better off loading them externally.

Read full topic

item.title: Dreamscape Loading Cursors from Cache
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“C++ Imbued, post:1, topic:428186”]Well frequently people have been asking for a fix on this so here it is.

@ Jframe.java find:

Replace that method with:

public static void setCursor(int id) { Toolkit toolkit = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit(); Cursor cursor = toolkit.createCustomCursor(toolkit.getImage(signlink.findcachedir()+ "Sprites/Cursors/Cursor "+id+".PNG"), new Point(0,0), signlink.findcachedir()+ "Sprites/Cursor "+id+".PNG"); frame.setCursor(cursor); }

Then add the Cursors into your Sprites folder of your cache and should be working good luck.

still working on a fix for the health glitch if anybody finds a fix for the health problem please release <3

Enjoy.

PLEASE NOTE HAVE NOT TESTED LOL NOT AT HOME ;/[/quote]
[tt]
Cursor cursor = toolkit.createCustomCursor(toolkit.getImage(signlink.findcachedir()+ “Sprites/Cursors/Cursor “+id+”.PNG”), new Point(0,0), signlink.findcachedir()+ “Sprites/Cursor “+id+”.PNG”);
[/tt]
is not loading that image from the rs2 filesystem…

Read full topic

item.title: Dreamscape Loading Cursors from Cache
item.dc:creator: @C_Imbued C++ Imbued
item.description:
@C_Imbued wrote:

Well frequently people have been asking for a fix on this so here it is.

@ Jframe.java find:

Replace that method with:

public static void setCursor(int id) { Toolkit toolkit = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit(); Cursor cursor = toolkit.createCustomCursor(toolkit.getImage(signlink.findcachedir()+ "Sprites/Cursors/Cursor "+id+".PNG"), new Point(0,0), signlink.findcachedir()+ "Sprites/Cursor "+id+".PNG"); frame.setCursor(cursor); }

Then add the Cursors into your Sprites folder of your cache and should be working good luck.

still working on a fix for the health glitch if anybody finds a fix for the health problem please release <3

Enjoy.

PLEASE NOTE HAVE NOT TESTED LOL NOT AT HOME ;/

Read full topic
